item.title: 2 - Basics
item.description: Theorem 2.1.2 a) If $z + a = a$ for some $z, a \in \mathbb{R}$, then $z = 0$. b) If $u \cdot b = b$ for some $u, b \in \mathbb{R}, b \ne 0$, then $u = 1$. c) If $a \in \mathbb{R}$, then $a \cdot 0 = 0$. proof: (placeholder) Theorem 2.1.3 a) If $a \cdot b = 1$ for some $a, b \in \mathbb{R}, a \ne 0$, then $b = 1/a$.
